task.title: Creating relationships
task.shortdesc: If your DITA map contains @href attributes for the <topicref> elements, you can use to create relationship tables that define relationships between the topics that are referenced in the DITA map.

taskbody.prereq:
Before you create a relationship table, you must have completed the following tasks:
Created a DITA map
Added <topicref> elements to your DITA map
Generated stub files

step.cmd: If the DITA Topic File Manager view is not open, open it. Click Window Show View Relationship Table Editor .
In the Relationship Table Editor window, click New Relationship Table icon .
step.stepresult: The New Relationship Table window opens.
Another New Relationship Table window opens.
The new relationship table is displayed in the Relationship Table Editor window.

step.cmd: Create a row in the relationship table for the "Brushing your teeth" topic:

substep.cmd: In the Map Editor view, select the "Brushing your teeth" topic, and drag it to the Tasks cell of row 1.
Select the "Toothbrush" topic and drag it to the Concepts cell of row 1.
Select the "Toothpaste" topic and drag it to Concepts cell of row 1. You can place it either before or after the "Toothbrush" topic.

step.cmd: Create a row in the relationship table for the "Flossing your teeth" topic:

substep.cmd: In the Map Editor view, select the "Flossing your teeth" topic, and drag it to the Tasks cell of row 2.
Select the "Dental floss" topic and drag it to the Concepts cell of row 2.

step.cmd: Create a row in the relationship table that defines a relationship between the "Cavities" topic and the "Stages of tooth decay" topic:

substep.cmd: In the Map Editor view, select the "Cavities" topic, and drag it to the Concepts cell of row 3.
Select the "Stages of tooth decay" topic and drag it to the Reference cell of row 3.

step.stepresult: The relationship table now has topics in three of its rows.

substep.cmd: Select row 5, right-click and then click Delete Row.
